abstract: Group of Northern Californian girls, barred from competing alongside Boy Scout troops, are latest to lobby for admittance to organization, citing evolving attitudes toward gender and sexuality; critics assert boys' need for exclusive time together, question wisdom of both sexes sharing tents, and recommend instead girls petition Girl Scouts for more diverse activities.
lead_paragraph: In a year in which gender roles in American institutions have undergone major changes and challenges, five girls in Santa Rosa say they want to spend more time camping and less selling cookies.

headline.main: ‘I Want to Be a Boy Scout.’ There’s Just One Hitch.
headline.print_headline: ‘I Want to Be a Boy Scout.’ There’s Just One Hitch.

snippet: In a year in which gender roles in American institutions have undergone major changes and challenges, five girls in Santa Rosa say they want to spend more time camping and less selling cookies.
